title: JAPANESE UDON RESTAURANT - Chef Assistant
description:
**Overview**  
Azuki is the passion project of Owner and Head Chef Ryuji Miyata, or as we call him "Chef". The core of the restaurant is the handmade noodles which Chef crafts daily, as well as the dashi soup our team creates over the course of two days. We are looking for assistants for the prepping and serving process of our noodle house.

**Responsibilities**

* During closed hours \- weighing out portions, prepping ingredients for cooking and topping, cleaning
* During open hours \- listening to incoming orders, gathering the requires ingredients, prepping them, and providing them to chef so he can prepare the final meal.

**Qualifications**

* Previous experience in food service, restaurant work, or culinary settings is preferred but not required; a strong interest in Japanese cuisine is a plus
* Decent Knife skills
* Knowledge of Japanese culture, ingredients, cuisine, and preferably language (even surface level Japanese language will help immensely.
* Ability to work in a small, fast paced kitchen.

This position is not customer facing, though if you choose opportunities for front positions will become available.

Join our team to gain hands\-on culinary experience in authentic Japanese cuisine while contributing to an exceptional dining experience for our guests.

Pay: $28\.26 \- $34\.03 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Paid training

title: Tour Leader- Japan
description:
Japan\-Based \| Recruitment Opens now for 2026\.


**Why Join Us?**


**Are you passionate about travel and ready to make the world your office?**  

If you’re a natural problem solver, calm under pressure, organised, and love delivering outstanding customer service, then a career as a Tour Leader could be your perfect fit!  

  

We are expanding our team and seeking passionate, professional, and energetic **Japan Tour Leaders** to guide our passengers through this fascinating destination.  

  

As a Tour Leader, you’ll be the heart and face of our brand, creating unforgettable moments for guests, from spontaneous laughs to awe\-inspiring landscapes. This is more than a job, it’s a vocation for those passionate about travel and hosting.  

  

**What we’re looking for:**


* Excellent customer service and communication skills
* Strong organisational and time management abilities
* Previous Tour Leader or Local Guide experience
* Confident leadership and team management skills
* Solid accounting and money\-handling foundations
* Strong research skills for destinations and itineraries
* Good knowledge of Japan — culture, geography, and travel logistics.
* High level of English proficiency (additional languages an advantage)
* Japanese language skills are highly advantageous, but not essential
* Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team
* A proactive, “solutions\-before\-problems” mindset

Ideally based in Japan or nearby, but not essential  
* 

**You’ll Bring:**


* **Passion \& Energy** – Bring destinations to life with enthusiasm, warmth, and storytelling that sparks connection.
* **Organisation \& Calm** – Juggle logistics, unexpected changes, and guest needs with poise and efficiency.
* **Leadership \& Empathy** – Be a guide, friend, and problem\-solver—turning groups of strangers into tight\-knit travel families.
* **Knowledge \& Responsiveness** – Know local gems, customs, transport, and cultural quirks. You'll also assist guests with practical needs like logistics or emergencies.
* **Professionalism Under Pressure** – Handle change with grace, while maintaining a fun, inclusive, and safe environment for everyone.
  


**Responsibilities at a Glance:**


* Deliver engaging narrative led introductions and destination insights.
* Manage on tour logistics, transport, accommodation, timings, liaising with suppliers to coordinate and reconfirm bookings on our multi day tours
* Serve as the go to support for guests \- personally, socially, and operationally.
* Lead with energy, even under pressure, and resolve issues calmly and creatively.
* Maintain group morale and ensure every guest feels included and informed.
* Day to day accounting.  

  

**What you’ll gain:**
* Compensation \- Competitive day rate along with additional earnable incentives and gratuities. Tipping is encouraged but not mandatory.
* Some living expenses are covered during a tour (accommodation, breakfast and some dinners)
* Get paid to explore exciting destinations and be part of the best road crew in Europe.
* Meet new people from around the world
* Tour Leader Accommodation is provided in private rooms on tour. We also provide one night of pre tour accommodation or an allowance to use towards this depending on the tour itinerary
* Daily allowance given for use of personal phone and data on tour
* Discounts on personal travel with the company.
* Uniform and training provided.
* Online support with tour slack channels to keep contact with the office and help support or answer any issues you may have on the road
* Emergency line to contact at any hour for support if needed

  


**Recruitment Details:**


**Recruitment for Tour Leader positions based in the Japan open now for 2026\.**  

  

**Please attach your CV, a cover letter or description of why you would like to join our company as a Tour Leader**

* Develop or modify menu items with approval of Culinary Control Budget.

* Assess the kitchen staff for a daily shift, work\-schedule as maximizing operation efficiency and decreasing labor cost.
* Approve employee's schedules, hours and timesheets for Cook I, II \& III
* Adhere to the sanitation standards in the kitchen as required by WDWC, the Company and the HACCP Program, also execute to maintain accurate record\-keeping which is required by the HACCP program.

* Evaluation support for head chef regarding Cook I, II and III cooking skills, behavior, attitude and compliance with corporate rules.
* Jump in operation and prepare food menu items at cooking when it’s required as the service becomes behind and there is an emergency shortage of the number of cooks.
* Assist in other areas as needed by business. Assist with Cook I, II \& III lunch break rotation.

* Determine what information, skills, and/or training are needed and do the necessary training. Inform Culinary Administration of Training
* Build skill test with Manager of Culinary Administration and HR. Administer skill test for promotions for Cook Department.
* When the head chef is not available, ensure operations are up to par while communicating with the chef about any issues with workers, guests or equipment.
* Assist with Butchering Meat and Fish Cut as necessary.


**Other Job Functions:**


* Estimate and schedules volume of food preparation for efficiency to meet with anticipated number of guests. Control excess and waste.

* Pre\-shift meeting with production

* Create and prepare Happy meal menu/ Employee meal menu.

* Three years of experience in Cook Dept. at Mitsukoshi.
* Culinary certificate or diploma preferred.
* Bi\-lingual in Japanese, preferred.

* Able to multi\-task with competing priorities and meet deadlines in a face pace environment.
* Able to work weekends and/or holidays as required.
* Able to communicate in English with supervisors, colleagues, and individuals inside and outside the company.

title: Senior Project Engineer
description:
**Senior Project Engineer – Gas Turbine (GT)**

  


**Company Overview**

At Mitsubishi Power, we're not just building better clean energy technologies; we're architecting a better future. Our team is boldly redefining power generation to accelerate the world's energy transition. We operate as one team, pushing toward our vision of the future. We value problem solvers, prioritize collaboration, and support each other in an inclusive culture built on accountability and authenticity by demonstrating our values: Safety, Family, Innovative, Inclusive, Accountable \& Courageous. Together, we’re building the future we all aspire to \- making net zero a reality.  


**Role Overview**

The GT Senior Project Engineer leads the engineering and design team, assuming overall responsibility for successful technical project execution. The GT Senior Project Engineer acts as a liaison between the engineering team, project management and the customer with the responsibility for integrating the various engineering, scheduling, and purchasing aspect of the project in accordance with contract obligations. Familiarity with gas turbine and gas turbine auxiliaries design and construction are required (mechanical, electrical, and I\&C). Familiarity with Steam turbine, Generator, and BOP design and construction is desirable.
**Key Responsibilities**


* Demonstrates our core competencies: Action oriented, change champion, customer\-focused, developing self \& others, and ownership
* Serve as the primary technical point of contact for EPC partners, Owner’s Engineers, and Customers, interpreting and integrating design requirements from customers or parent company in accordance with contract specifications.
* Lead planning, setup, and monitoring of project engineering systems, including kick‑offs, MDLs, DORs, contract deviation lists, and inter‑discipline workflows; coordinate engineering activities and resolve cross‑disciplinary issues.
* Translate contract requirements and scope of work into actionable engineering deliverables for discipline teams, ensuring alignment with contractual obligations.
* Monitor engineering schedules, budgets, and estimates through project completion, including periodic reviews, two‑week look‑ahead planning, expediting activities, escalation of action items, and preparation of technical delivery status reports.
* Support Project Managers and Lead Project Engineers in tracking and assessing design changes, engineering change notices (ECNs), and contract deviations, including impact evaluation.
* Coordinate regularly with international affiliated companies to support successful engineering execution and project delivery.
* Review and comment on project documents and drawings to ensure compliance with contractual document flow and technical requirements.
* Support equipment specification, bid evaluation, vendor selection, and capacity assessments for MPWA‑sourced equipment on Gas Turbine and Combined Cycle projects.
* Maintain working knowledge of applicable engineering codes and standards for combustion turbines and auxiliary systems, including ASME, ANSI, AWS, API, ASTM, NFPA, and NEC.
* Collaborate with Global Sourcing, Quality Assurance, and Project Management to coordinate vendors and subcontractors throughout execution.
* Support Application Engineering in reviewing and evaluating customer specifications in coordination with the parent company, as required.
* Track and resolve open technical and contractual items through project completion and into the warranty period, ensuring closure of outstanding issues.
* Demonstrate strong multitasking and multidisciplinary communication skills across engineering, sourcing, and project teams.

**Requirements**


* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering required; Master’s degree in Engineering preferred.
* 10–20 years of directly related technical experience in engineering or power project execution.
* Professional Engineer (P.E.) license preferred.
* Experience with SP3D and other 3D design tools such as SmartPlant or PDMS.
* Knowledge of ISO procedures and OSHA safety requirements.
* International business experience, including collaboration with global teams.
* Proficiency with project management and office tools, including MS Project, Excel, Word, Outlook, Visio, and technical diagrams/flowcharts.
* Strong technical interpretation skills, with the ability to analyze complex instructions presented in mathematical or diagrammatic form and manage both abstract and practical variables.
* Japanese and/or Spanish language fluency is a plus.
* Willingness to travel to customer offices and construction sites as required.

**Why Should You Apply?**


* Excellent Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision \& 401K Matching).
* Excellent development programs and advancement opportunities.
* Tuition reimbursement and on\-the\-job training.
* Paid vacation, sick time, and holidays.
* Committed to quality products and services.
* Great working environment and culture.
* Employee Appreciation Programs and Event.

title: Relationship Manager - Vice President (Bilingual Japanese/English Required)
description:
SMBC Group is a top\-tier global financial group. Headquartered in Tokyo and with a 400\-year history, SMBC Group offers a diverse range of financial services, including banking, leasing, securities, credit cards, and consumer finance. The Group has more than 130 offices and 80,000 employees worldwide in nearly 40 countries. Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group, Inc. (SMFG) is the holding company of SMBC Group, which is one of the three largest banking groups in Japan. SMFG’s shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York (NYSE: SMFG) stock exchanges.

  

In the Americas, SMBC Group has a presence in the US, Canada, Mexico, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, and Peru. Backed by the capital strength of SMBC Group and the value of its relationships in Asia, the Group offers a range of commercial and investment banking services to its corporate, institutional, and municipal clients. It connects a diverse client base to local markets and the organization’s extensive global network. The Group’s operating companies in the Americas include Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corp. (SMBC), SMBC Nikko Securities America, Inc., SMBC Capital Markets, Inc., SMBC MANUBANK, JRI America, Inc., SMBC Leasing and Finance, Inc., Banco Sumitomo Mitsui Brasileiro S.A., and Sumitomo Mitsui Finance and Leasing Co., Ltd.

  

The anticipated salary range for this role is between $143,000\.00 and $225,000\.00\. The specific salary offered to an applicant will be based on their individual qualifications, experiences, and an analysis of the current compensation paid in their geography and the market for similar roles at the time of hire. The role may also be eligible for an annual discretionary incentive award. In addition to cash compensation, SMBC offers a competitive portfolio of benefits to its employees.

**Role Description**
--------------------


This role is within the Japanese \& Asian Corporate Banking Department. The main function of this position is to build business connection with Japanese clients in Industrials, Auto and Chemical sectors based in New York and surrounding area and gather information relating to finance and business development. Report to Group Head and closely collaborate with other Relationship Managers and product partners.

**Role Objectives**
-------------------

* Build business connection with Japanese clients in Industrials, Auto, and Chemical sectors.
* Gather information relating to finance and business development with these clients above.
* Gather information on recent trends and activities of these sectors above.
* Support in preparation and presentation of client materials (presentations, proposals, etc.).
* Maintain client relationship, cultivate clients’ banking needs and promote banking products.
* Provide ad hoc reports for management.
**Qualifications and Skills**
-----------------------------

* Minimum 3 years of working experience in corporate/investment banking.
* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business or Accounting preferred or equivalent education and training.
* Solid communication skills with an ability to coordinate and communicate with various external and internal stakeholders.
* Highly proficient MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint skills are required.
* Japanese and English language skills (business level) required.

SMBC’s employees participate in a Hybrid workforce model that provides employees with an opportunity to work from home, as well as, from an SMBC office. SMBC requires that employees live within a reasonable commuting distance of their office location. Prospective candidates will learn more about their specific hybrid work schedule during their interview process. Hybrid work may not be permitted for certain roles, including, for example, certain FINRA\-registered roles for which in\-office attendance for the entire workweek is required.

  

SMBC provides reasonable accommodations during candidacy for applicants with disabilities consistent with applicable federal, state, and local law. If you need a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know at accommodations@smbcgroup.com.

title: Part-Time Japanese Language Instructor (Remote – 1:1 | VR & Video Platform)
description:
**About IMMERSE**
-----------------


IMMERSE is a language learning platform that helps adults build real fluency through live instruction and AI\-powered practice in contextual 3D environments. We provide immersive, high\-quality language instruction designed for real workplace communication. We partner with organizations globally to deliver high\-quality, workplace\-ready language learning that's interactive, practical, and human.


**The Role**
------------


We're hiring part\-time Japanese language instructors to teach 1:1 communicative lessons to adult learners. Sessions take place either on the IMMERSE platform or via video conferencing software, depending on the learner's program and class type.


We're seeking experienced, professionally trained instructors who can confidently guide adult learners through structured, speaking\- and listening\-focused sessions. Your role will be to help learners build confidence and fluency through purposeful, real\-time interaction.


Whether teaching inside the IMMERSE app – using immersive VR environments such as meeting rooms, cafés, and workplace simulations\- or leading live video sessions, you will be expected to deliver:


* High engagement and energy
* Clear lesson structure and pacing
* Strong pedagogical intentionality
* Consistent learner progress toward communicative goals


This is a structured teaching role designed for educators with strong training in language pedagogy, demonstrated experience developing adult learners' speaking and listening skills, and comfort using technology in the classroom.


**Why You'll Love Teaching with IMMERSE**
-----------------------------------------


**Innovative platform:** Teach in immersive VR environments purpose\-built for communicative language development — not generic virtual classrooms.


**Personalized impact:** Work 1:1 with adult learners to meaningfully accelerate their speaking confidence and real\-world fluency.


**Professionally motivated learners:** Teach working professionals sponsored by their companies,


**Pedagogy\-Driven Community:** Collaborate with fellow educators who care deeply about instructional quality, learner progress, and authentic connection.


**Global, Meaningful Work:** Help learners around the world gain the confidence to speak Japanese in professional and everyday settings.


**What We're Looking For**
--------------------------


### **Required Qualifications**


* BA in Japanese Language Education, Applied Linguistics, or a closely related field.  

(If the degree is not directly related, a Japanese language teaching certification and extensive Japanese language teaching experience is required.)

2\+ years of structured Japanese language teaching experience.  
* 

Experience teaching adult learners speaking and listening skills in professional or academic contexts.  
* 

Strong foundation in communicative and task\-based language teaching.  
* 

Demonstrated ability to intentionally develop adult learners' speaking and listening skills (not just follow a textbook).  
* 

Near\-native or native\-level Japanese proficiency (JLPT N1 equivalent or ACTFL Advanced High).  
* 

Minimum B2\-level English proficiency.  
* 

Comfortable using technology and learning new platforms.  
* 
* Organized, reliable, and able to follow established processes while communicating proactively.

  

  

**This role likely is not the right fit if:**
---------------------------------------------


Your teaching experience is limited to casual conversation practice or informal tutoring.


You have taught primarily children with no adult teaching experience.


You cannot commit to consistent availability.


**Compensation**
----------------


Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience, qualifications, and geographic location.


Compensation includes instructional sessions, designated preparation time, required onboarding, and scheduled operational meetings.


**Tech Requirements**
---------------------


To ensure class stability and consistency, all applicants must meet the following:


Windows 10 or 11 (64\-bit) PC


Intel i5\-1135G7 / AMD Ryzen 5 5500U or better


Intel Iris Xe / AMD Vega 7 or better graphics


8GB RAM


10GB free storage


Ethernet connection required with minimum 50 Mbps download / 20 Mbps upload (Wi\-Fi only setups are not supported)


Wired headset with built\-in microphone


**Location \& Eligibility**
---------------------------


We are unable to hire residents of California, Oregon, Massachusetts, Kentucky, Minnesota, Nevada, New Hampshire, or Washington at this time.
